⚡️Missed yesterday’s press conference? Catch up here!
https://t.co/JA09JAN2Ie
https://t.co/vfAWmm0TXF
Watch again: Draghi on Christine @Lagarde’s nomination for ECB President https://t.co/BdLBrYArqM
Watch again: Draghi on the ECB’s mandate https://t.co/dqHfveVW0l
Watch again: Draghi on manufacturing slowing down and the importance of fiscal policy https://t.co/2svWVLXwkF
Watch again: Draghi on how the ECB sees the risk of recession as low https://t.co/O9QMGe0v6h
Watch Again: Draghi on the stance of global regulators towards Facebook’s Libra and other such initiatives https://t.co/zF4TylyS4Y
Watch Again: Draghi on the ECB’s commitment to symmetry in its inflation aim https://t.co/R7UL0avcFp
Draghi: Christine @Lagarde will be an outstanding president of the ECB
Draghi: Monetary policy has done a lot to support the euro area. But if we continue with this deterioration, fiscal policy will become of the essence
Draghi: Symmetry means that there is no cap at 2%, means that the Governing Council will act with the same determination if inflation is above and below 2%
Draghi: We don’t like what we see on the inflation front. Symmetry means we will act with same determination whether inflation is above or below the inflation aim
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/SjioMRJBf3
Draghi: The lingering of the uncertainty is by it self a materialisation of one of the risks
Draghi: Outlook is getting worse and worse in manufacturing
Draghi: There was broad agreement on the current outlook at today's meeting

Draghi: Countries where government debt is high need to continue rebuilding fiscal buffers and all countries should reinforce their efforts to achieve a more growth-friendly composition of public finances

Draghi: The implementation of structural reforms in euro area countries needs to be substantially stepped up to boost euro area productivity and growth potential, reduce structural unemployment and increase resilience

Draghi: A significant degree of monetary stimulus continues to be necessary for financial conditions to remain very favourable and support the euro area expansion, the ongoing build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term
Draghi: Inflationary pressures remain muted and indicators of inflation expectations have declined

Draghi: We have tasked Eurosystem Committees to examine options, including ways to reinforce forward guidance, mitigating measures, such as the design of a tiered system for reserve remuneration, and options for the size/composition of potential new net asset purchases
Draghi: The Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its instruments, as appropriate, to ensure that inflation moves towards its aim in a sustained manner
Draghi: The Governing Council is determined to act, in line with its commitment to symmetry in the inflation aim

Draghi: The Governing Council also underlined the need for a highly accommodative stance of monetary policy for a prolonged period of time, as inflation rates, both realised and projected, have been persistently below levels that are in line with its aim

Draghi: We expect interest rates to remain at their present or lower levels at least through the first half of 2020, and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure the continued sustained convergence of inflation to our aim over the medium term
Watch ECB press conference live: President Mario Draghi explains today’s monetary policy decisions https://t.co/E4Z5Xj8mRn

The Governing Council of the ECB has no objection to the recommendation of #ECOFIN to appoint Christine @Lagarde as the next ECB President. Next steps:

▶️ Consultation of @Europarl_EN
▶️ Final appointment by European Council in October

https://t.co/njrePuF5uJ https://t.co/73ryqaDpeh

We asked around 150 banks in the euro area about changes in their lending behaviour and loan demand during the second quarter of 2019. Find out the results https://t.co/sMmavsRCQk https://t.co/q6qyuBD8YV

On 4 July the Working Group on risk free rates discussed the €STR legal action plan. There were also updates on cash and derivative products, risk management and financial accounting, communication and term rates methodologies. Check out the minutes https://t.co/arh6yj8nEa

Today, Frankfurt showed its pride at the 2019 Christopher Street Day parade 🏳️‍🌈

The ECB was proud to be a part of it with more than 300 ECB staff dancing through the streets of Frankfurt. We’re already looking forward to next year!

Our euro, our #pride. https://t.co/jFtAN953qp

You have two weeks left to apply to present your paper at the next ECB conference on fiscal policy and Economic and Monetary Union governance. We’re looking for papers on a variety of topics. Find out more https://t.co/hB1lISMdw7 https://t.co/sxFNKmJVHB

€STR, the new short-term rate coming later this year, will gradually replace EONIA. What should market participants do about new and legacy contracts referencing EONIA? Read the recommendations from the working group on euro risk-free rates https://t.co/cUWA6Mt5pt https://t.co/59Hyl2bDt2
Congratulations from one ECB to another #ICCWorldCup2019 #CWC19 https://t.co/H6Wj0QcOBU

All benchmark rates should have a fall-back rate that can be used if the main rate is not available. The working group on risk-free rates is therefore looking for an administrator for a benchmark rate that could serve as fall-back to EURIBOR https://t.co/rOgFhy908s

Do you know what an interest rate benchmark is? A new benchmark – the euro short-term rate (€STR) – will be launched in October 2019. Not sure what this means or why it matters? Read our explainer to find out https://t.co/QgAfIO1hWI https://t.co/98VKGJxjT2

This weekend Frankfurt’s Christopher Street Day festival takes place, celebrating LGBT+ #pride. ECB colleagues will be marching in the parade on Saturday. Read more about diversity and inclusion at the ECB https://t.co/7o3sW8ft98 https://t.co/0kwwni1RY8

The ECB Governing Council has appointed Edouard Fernandez-Bollo, Kerstin af Jochnick & Elizabeth McCaul as ECB representatives to the Supervisory Board. The Supervisory Board is responsible for planning and carrying out the ECB’s banking supervision tasks https://t.co/oimnl9WoM1

https://t.co/JtTqg1IBaM
Time to wrap up. Thanks a lot for your questions – I really enjoyed the conversation and look forward to doing it again soon. Philip R. Lane #AskECB https://t.co/C686ILXshq
Lane: Definitely the liver bird #LiverpoolFC #youllneverwalkalone #LFC #AskECB https://t.co/1fIoWgEPG0

Lane: Euro banknotes already do: they come in different sizes - the higher the value, the bigger the banknote, for example. See here for more features for the visually impaired: https://t.co/hNB9axgBP6 #AskECB https://t.co/PrSRzabEsh

Lane: The optimal currency area (OCA) concept is very useful - but does not provide a precise roadmap. I would highlight the roles of macroprudential policies, banking and capital markets union and an effective fiscal framework. #AskECB https://t.co/MOExQwtZ4w

Lane: Our goal is not to make markets happy, but rather to provide favourable financing conditions that can stimulate the real economy and anchor inflation expectations #AskECB https://t.co/9xbmqiANqN

Lane: We are constantly assessing the risks and side effects of our policies. We are transparent on this: please take a look at the accounts of Governing Council meetings https://t.co/BlYlwUNFRc #AskECB https://t.co/gltRvujfmk
Lane: She is an excellent choice for the ECB. I am very much looking forward to working with her. #AskECB https://t.co/m23AIXM3qF

Lane: Our asset purchases have been very successful by lowering financing conditions for firms and households and have led to the creation of millions of new jobs over recent years.  #AskECB https://t.co/ZTo73egcOu

Lane: Since 2014, our policies have been successful in eliminating deflation risk and fostering strong recovery in employment in Europe. Financial stability risks remain contained. Our focus is on returning inflation to our aim #AskECB https://t.co/faPq2Bo2jg

Lane: Yes, we are prepared and ready to act if needed to keep inflation on track towards our aim. We certainly have the tools and we have a good performance record in responding to various sources of risks. Our policies are most effective if other actors do their part #AskECB https://t.co/mZTvrNtyDJ

Lane: Banking union and the creation of a level playing field - including a key role for the single supervisory mechanism (SSM) - provide important support for a more efficient pan-European banking system. #AskECB https://t.co/xY1R1Rs4Ic
Lane: No. Bitcoin is not a currency, it rather is an asset and it is very volatile #AskECB https://t.co/XQ9Mqdm5rU
Lane: We have a variety of tools in our kit. When we need to use them, we will choose the one most suitable for the situation #AskECB https://t.co/NZlhjIsSmw
Lane: The links between monetary and fiscal policy have been much studied over many years. Just to be clear – monetary financing is prohibited by the EU Treaty #AskECB https://t.co/CJL8vEa7z0

Lane: The counter-cyclical (CCyB) is an important tool that can help avoid a credit squeeze in a future downturn. By raising the CCyB in good times, it can be reduced if there is a negative shock in the future. #AskECB https://t.co/2yxm3zzYuw

Lane: We are already buying EIB bonds, classified as supranational bonds. 
The supranational bond purchases amount to €230 billion. The list of eligible assets is here https://t.co/OBLNDXlwSi #AskECB https://t.co/1hhOqdKOSS
Lane: The ECB is, and will remain, fully independent and sets its policies in pursuit of its mandate of maintaining price stability #AskECB https://t.co/Nfaoe0EgPL

Lane: While we certainly find it useful to examine monetary aggregates, shifts in money demand mean that it is not a good idea to overly focus on monetary volumes as an intermediate policy target #AskECB https://t.co/ccyy3jMPIe

Lane: Here is the link to the papers
https://t.co/e1VW1eLuMI
https://t.co/7rvdtd0OmJ 
#AskECB

Lane: The first half of 2012 saw much debate about the future of the euro but much happened in Summer 2012, including the famous "whatever it takes" speech. The euro area today is much stronger. Further improvements in the architecture would be welcome. #AskECB https://t.co/uzUoTYY5Yd

Lane: We are not here to give investment advice – remember, you invest at your own risk. By the way, it is a high hurdle for a crypto-asset to satisfy the definition of a currency. More in our explainer https://t.co/lxCIuhzlZH #AskECB https://t.co/zu5x9HKdmZ
Lane: You’ll find the list of banks participating in our instant payments system here https://t.co/CchbrCjUWL #AskECB https://t.co/YOKLGFzF8v

Lane: It has always been the case that technological progress is associated with a trend increase in the relative price of services compared to manufacturing. Such relative price movements are not new and do not change the economics of inflation #AskECB https://t.co/AUHt7CQMQA
Lane: Benoît Cœuré, my colleague on the ECB’s Executive Board, leads the G7 working group on stablecoins. The group will present its initial findings on 17 July #AskECB https://t.co/b3Fyp840wn
Lane: We do not see a recession, although the prolongation of uncertainties is weighing on our growth outlook #AskECB https://t.co/m59Y0x1e6X

Lane: Pro-active measures (including negative rates) are the surest way to ensure inflation climbs to our aim: a temporary period of negative rates is the pathway to positive rates in the future. #AskECB https://t.co/AEV4ARWpx0
Lane: While some households may save more, others will avail of low rates to increase consumption and household investment (home renovations etc.) #AskECB https://t.co/gRnhDXGsQR

Lane: Our policies support higher consumption and investment, even if there are differences across households and firms. Financial stability risks should be primarily addressed through macroprudential policies. The European Semester monitors fiscal and reform efforts  #AskECB https://t.co/cfmb874BwD

Lane: While the euro area is doing well along some dimensions, inflation remains below target and there are downside risks to the growth outlook. Substantial accommodation is still required to bring inflation back to aim. If more easing is needed, we have the tools #AskECB https://t.co/rdnMJD3T7p

Lane: The Phillips Curve is a useful framework : it combines the dual influences of activity levels and inflation expectations in determining inflation outcomes. At the ECB, we look at many specifications of the Phillips Curve, rather than rely on a single version.  #AskECB https://t.co/oTmu6OPCn8

Lane: We meet every six weeks to discuss monetary policy and take decisions. We continuously assess the state of the economy and stand ready to act to keep inflation on a path to our aim #AskECB https://t.co/z92DQCG28o
Lane: Thank you, I am very happy to be here at the ECB. I’m liking Frankfurt so far and I’m sure that I’ll continue to enjoy it #AskECB https://t.co/W2mDuzDX0Z

Good afternoon, this is Philip R. Lane. I joined the ECB as Chief Economist on 1 June. I’m here to answer your questions for the next 45 minutes. Please use #AskECB to join the conversation. https://t.co/GeqaBfKryA
Now also available in English https://t.co/u0lxBzNrk6 https://t.co/sIppyrgZUl
